notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Commercial Facilities, Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Transportation Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC/ICS-CERT recommends that users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS -CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to ICS-CERT for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

product.name: OnCell G3110-HSDPA: Version 1.2 Build 09123015 and previous versions
OnCell G3150-HSDPA: Version 1.4 Build 11051315 and previous versions
OnCell G3110-HSPA: Version 1.3 build 15082117 and previous versions

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts

notes.text: An attacker can freely use brute force to determine parameters needed to bypass authentication.CVE-2017-7915 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: For OnCell G31x0-HSPA and OnCell 5x04-HSPA devices users should upgrade to the latest official firmware Version 1.4 or above.

For OnCell G31x0-HSDPA and OnCell 5x04-HSDPA devices users should disable HTTP and use other another console such as HTTPS to access web UI or SNMP/Telnet. Moxa reports that the HSDPA devices have been phased out. If further assistance is needed, please contact Moxa.

notes.text: The application 's configuration file contains parameters that represent passwords in plaintext.CVE-2017-7913 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.3 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: For OnCell G31x0-HSPA and OnCell 5x04-HSPA devices users should upgrade to the latest official firmware Version 1.4 or above.

For OnCell G31x0-HSDPA and OnCell 5x04-HSDPA devices users should disable HTTP and use other another console such as HTTPS to access web UI or SNMP/Telnet. Moxa reports that the HSDPA devices have been phased out. If further assistance is needed, please contact Moxa.

notes.text: The application does not sufficiently verify if a request was intentionally provided by the user who submitted the request, which could allow an attacker to modify the configuration of the device.CVE-2017-7917 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: For OnCell G31x0-HSPA and OnCell 5x04-HSPA devices users should upgrade to the latest official firmware Version 1.4 or above.

For OnCell G31x0-HSDPA and OnCell 5x04-HSDPA devices users should disable HTTP and use other another console such as HTTPS to access web UI or SNMP/Telnet. Moxa reports that the HSDPA devices have been phased out. If further assistance is needed, please contact Moxa.
